intro: Ecbolium khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in dry, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are predominantly pale green to yellowish in color. Ecbolium khasiana is often found in forest margins and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
